derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English spīr 'tall slender stem of a plant'; related to German Spier 'tip of a blade of grass'
mid 16th cent. (in the general sense 'a spiral'): from French, or via Latin from Greek speira 'a coil'

entry.tran: (教堂等建筑物顶部的)尖塔，尖顶
entry.def: The spire of a building such as a church is the tall pointed structure on the top.

means.word_mean: 1. a tall tower that forms the superstructure of a building (usually a church or temple) and that tapers to a point at the top
